system.description:
This spell allows the caster to make one other magic-user spell of 7th level or lower permanent. However, this spell cannot be used on:

  • Spells with an instantaneous or permanent duration (e.g., dispel magic, fireball, lightning bolt).
  • Any clerical spells.
  • Any 8th or 9th level magic-user spells.

Rules & Restrictions:

  • The DM may decide that certain spell combinations are unbalanced and disallow them.
  • Dispel Magic cast by the original caster or a higher-level caster can remove the permanence effect (normal chances for success apply).
  • Items can only have one permanent spell, except weapons (see below).
  • Creatures can only have two permanent spells. Attempting a third will automatically fail.
  • Weapons can have up to five permanent spells, but each beyond the first has a 25% chance of failure. If a failure occurs, the weapon is completely destroyed.

Common Uses of Permanence:

On Creatures:

  • Detect Magic
  • Protection from Evil
  • Read Languages
  • Read Magic
  • Detect Invisible
  • Fly

On Areas:

  • Light
  • Phantasmal Force
  • Confusion
  • Cloudkill

Magical Items & Permanence:

A permanence spell does not enchant objects; it only binds a spell to an object, making it more fragile than a true enchanted item. A magic-user does not need Permanence to create permanent magical items.
system.effect: Causes one magical effect to become permanent
